content:
Thank you, chrrist1, for putting up with me.

The top section of Local Folders, from the first inbox to the first Outbox appeared against my wish. I had suspected that it had something to do with me inadvertently having linked Thunderbird to my gmail account (a link I definitely don't want).

You helped me to get rid of the connection to gmail but the spare Local Folders section is still there. Trying to sort it made me realize that I might be missing the proper Server Settings.

The full pathway to the Local Directory is: C:\Users\Windows User\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\828m3ixh.default\Mail\Local Folders

Thank you again for your kindness, Ulrike
creator: u.i.hill

content:
From your screenshot it looks like you did create a 'Local Folders' folder underneath the 'Local Folders' account. Is this the case?

Unfortunately your second screenshot is cut off at the right hand side. What's full path of the 'Local Directory' setting for the 'Local Folders' account?
creator: christ1
